intro: Palala commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's palala, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. It has a short stem with a dense cluster of leaves at the top. The flowers are pollinated by insects and produce small, round fruits that contain seeds.
